page.title: 03Sewage 1
page.content: East Anglian Water Authority, Chelmsford{CM2 6NZ. "When I flush the lavatory I never think about what happens next." The sewage comes from a large area around Chelmsford.It consists of all lavatory and bath waste.There are 2 main sewage pipes into the sewage works.First the rags are removed.Then the grit is removed.The sewage is taken up a spiral conveyor which helps separation into liquid and sludge. There are storm channels which take the extra water when there is a heavy rain fall, otherwise the works would flood. There are large cone tanks where the sludge is collected and because the sludge is heavier than water, it sinks to the bottom.The sludge is kept at 98.4deg.F. or 37deg.C.in a tank with no oxygen for 1 month.{ Cont. on Sewage 2
